rev.comment: This addition was not necessary -- this is an historical reality, not an interpretation of history.
Removed the era designation 'AD' to better conform with the manual of style
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/202.55.159.214|202.55.159.214]] ([[User talk:202.55.159.214|talk]]) to last version by 160.36.123.56
Corrected grammar in the first sentence.
rv and reorganize links. Cut some that were overly specific or polemical
/* Conversion of the Slavs */ Clarify linguistic situation
NOT unnecessary. Leaving this out is what could cause confusion.
rv unnecessary and potentially misleading addition
Be careful how one phrases things...
links, wording, rem. Armenia (as it is [[Oriental Orthodox]], not EO); this article seems to be plagued with bad spelling and awkward writing
/* Monasticism /* "do not so social work" to "do not usually do social work"; wording
/* Understanding the Term "Mystery" */ regularized usage, capitalization and italicization
/* Understanding the Term "Mystery" */ regularized capitalization and italicization
/* Monasticism */ No, not always -- see [[Clerical celibacy]].
/* The Roman/Byzantine Empire */ Correct sadly obvious falsehood
/* The Theotokos */ fixed capitalization, replaced smartquotes
Joseph was a widower, not a widow.
robot Adding: ko, no Modifying: bg, de, nl, ro
/* Icons */ Various copyedits and corrections -- avoid cliche and capitalize according to standard and not according to personal idiosyncrasy.
/* The Theotokos */ Deletion of the distasteful non-sequitur "and we like little boys."
Bringing "External links" and "See also" sections in line with [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] recommendations.
reverting convoluted anon. edits and non-EO link (belongs in [[Oriental Orthodoxy]])
better organization/more "professional".. ex. church architecture has nothing to do with how orthodox christians "act"
thusly -> thus (see [[List of words with disputed usage]])
/* The Incarnation */ Fixed capitalization and syntax -- also tightened up "nature" language to be more accurate.
/* The Incarnation */ Replaced inacurate text, see discussion on topic
/* The Theotokos */ More info on the Theotokos
/* Repentance */ better to spell out the names of Bible books for readers unfamiliar with the abbreviations
rvv, correcting ref, added link, fixed typos
added ref. to 2nd largest Orthodox group in the world (Romania)
Nothing against the Bulgarians, but they're not really one of the first Orthodox groups thought of in the English-speaking world.
/* The Theotokos */ That's so, but not really germane to this article
rv. Oversimplifies to the point of inaccuracy
/* External links */ rem. non-notable link, expanded text for existing link
added pic of church in [[Columbus, Ohio]]
/* Who Orthodox Christians Are Historically */ Fixing more incorrect capitals; see [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style]]
/* How Orthodox Christians Act */ Fixing this and a few other incorrect capitals in section headings; see [[wikipedia:Manual of Style]]
/* Marriage */ Using : instead of space to indent paragraphs
/* Tradition */ spell out and link 1 Thessalonians, mention sola scriptura
/* External links */ move link into a subsection entitled /* Outside perspectives */
/* External links */ rv -- Should a link like this really be given such prominence?
/* External links */ removed link to personal site

How did this managed to get missing?
rv to ASDamick's last version, as some edits were inaccurate. Placed Mysteries in more common grouping and order. Some copyedits
rv various culture-specific and/or badly spelled/worded edits
/* Salvation */ Better no presentation of [[original sin]] than a false presentation
rv various fanciful and/or RC POV edits
/* Salvation */ correcting misrepresentation of doctrine of original sin
/* The Early Church */ disambiguation link repair ([[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|You can help!]])
punc & disambiguation link repair ([[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|You can help!]])
/* Baptism & Chrismation */ added information found at OrthoWiki
rv -- Not true. Read the relevant portions of [[clerical celibacy]].

editing to reduce excessive size; more required
Editing to reduce unwieldy size and condense text; more required
editing of excessive detail, complex construction, and excessive length; more requred.
some efforts made toward neutrality in presentation; more is required, as well as summarizing parts of this awkwardly lengthy article

/* Related articles */ added categories and rearranged for better order
/* Sin and Redemption */ Merley confirming their rejeciton of "Origional Sin."
/* Saints, relics, and those who have passed on */ clarification
/* Saints, relics, and those who have passed on */ Changes to reflect that there is no proess of Canonization in the Orthodox Church
/* Saints, relics, and those who have passed on */
/* Autonomous churches */ UOC-MP's official name is just UOC
/* External links */ this link belongs on [[Oriental Orthodoxy]], not here
/* The Priesthood */ This is not a recognized part of the Eastern Orthodox Church.
/* The Cycle of Services */ a llittle clarification
/* Matins */ It is only 1 hour at most churches I've attended
/* Incense */ avoid abbreviating books of the Bible, as not all readers will be familiar with them
/* How Orthodox Christians Act */ baptism and chrismation are holy mysteries
/* The Bible */ moving part to another section
/* The Trinity */ copyedit, fix link. ("Ousia" appears to be a band.)
rv. Anon edit gave incorrect facts
/* Saints, relics, and those who have passed on */ links, general copyedit
/* The Trinity */ fixed typo and expanded triadology
/* How Orthodox Christians Act */ Added Pic
/* Icons */ All the Icons mentioned are Russian and my vote is for Saint Luke and the most famous Icon Painter
/* Icons */ there was some weird stuff in here, I tried to carify and "illuminate" a bit
/* Incense */ There is no abstinance from incense. if this is a local custom; I have never heard of it, and I have a pretty extensive experience.
/* Isolated Orthodox jurisdictions */ Added Montenegrin Church, alphabetized

complete reorganization - please review - nothing altared in text
Complete Reorganization - nothing altered in text - please assist, may have made some errors
trying to prevent includes from piling up to the right (firefox and msie)
BC and AD are Christian, and still not "antiquated"
BC and AD is antiquated - modern usage is BCE and CE
/* Internal differences in Eastern Orthodoxy */ to rightly divide means to correctly teach and despence, not whether you are in communion with others
/* Internal differences in Eastern Orthodoxy */ Copyedit, corrected ecclesiology
edits had nothing to do with "clarity" and everything to do with bias. Material facts should not be removed.
The last edit changed a great deal of the meaning. What is said is carefully considered for accuracy. Take care not to change the meaning.
let's not get into blind doctrinal assertions in the first paragraph, eh?
added Moldovan Metropolitan Church and Metropolitan Church of Bessarabia, http://www.azi.md/news?ID=8910
minor correction...there were not two churches at the time of the first split
The local churches of Orthodoxy are not "denominations."
rm extensive list. This article is already long, and such a list does not belong in an intro.
/* Eastern Orthodoxy and Roman Catholicism */ papal infallibility is not "all-encompassing". Reword.
mostly copyedits in the list of distinctives
Orthodox need to be defined by who they are, not where they are
rv. We have been trying to get away from immediate comparisons with the RCs. Look on the talk page.
/* Related articles */ Eastern Orthodoxy is also a part of Middle Eastern history.
Reverting -- "Semi-Pelagianism" has a specific technical meaning which Orthodoxy does not hold to.
rv -- The only "some" in whose opinion it's an addition is [[User:Lima|Lima]]'s. See: [[Talk:Eastern Rite]].
/* Orthodoxy in North America */ oops...double negative
/* Orthodoxy in North America */ Different jurisdictions in same area is not canonical
/* Fasting */ Keep it NPOV, and accurate
/* Mystery of Repentance */ definite article creates biased feel
/* Salvation and the afterlife */ removing RC ideas
